Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with two added white bands; exterior: undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: The lack of interior decoration suggests that the sherd could be as early as the 630BC-600BC Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0077) (phase 2)
